item.title: Beogram 4000: Restoring the Slow Slide Transport Function
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, a problem was encountered where the tonearm carriage would continue moving after attempting to move it in reverse. This issue stemmed from a damaged keypad switch, specifically a bent contact terminal that prevented a clean shut-off connection. This damage was likely caused by a previous repair attempt. To address this, the control panel and circuit board were removed to access and extract the switch terminals...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-restoring-the-slow-slide-transport-function/

item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacing the Light Bulbs in the Control Panel with LEDs
item.description:
Following the replacement of the reservoir and motor capacitors in the Beogram 4000, I focused on upgrading the control panel’s light bulbs. LEDs offer greater long-term stability and are generally preferable replacements for incandescent bulbs, except in cases where the original circuitry or aesthetics demand otherwise. Given that the control panel’s lighting is internal and not directly visible, LEDs are a suitable replacement. In this instance, one of the bulbs illuminating the position scale had failed, causing the entire scale to go dark due to the series arrangement of the two bulbs...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-replacing-the-light-bulbs-in-the-control-panel-with-leds/
